authority within the group was delegated by the parent company board across

bare minimum of local directors were retained for legal compliance 
purposes; that is, to rubber stamp decisions made and often already

Today's crazy Morton Feldman compositional tool of note: he always envied how painters could just paint over mistakes and keep going, so he tried to do the same when he composed. If bars were not right on the first pass you'd be left with the mistake written in to have to play, or even crazier is that he'd cross out the bars, so you still had to play them but as bars of rest. Gives the pieces the feeling of pauses for deep thought during intense conversation.

We were on a street in some weird mixture of Wellington and Melbourne. We were outside an expensive hotel, we just had eaten and I was heavy with a few wines and a meal. My brother had a son, the child was maybe three or four. I hated him. He looked exactly like Ryan did, but mixed with a bit of his wife Dani. The kid was a little piece of shit that was full of entitlement and I wanted to slap him. None of this had anything to do with the fact that Ryan had decided to disown my parents and I. He was aggressively asserting his distaste for us now that he had a family of his own. He could finally move on from us now that he had started again. He could be the father of this new family and he had outgrown the need for a father of his own. We got into an minor altercation on the street outside the hotel and he made violent threats to us all. Meg and I consoled my parents over coffee and left the scene. 

We were then at a safe house on the side of a mountain, out in the countryside. The scene started on the porch. It was here that I realised I was actually making decisions of consequence to the logic of the dream world, that it was lucid, so I decided to go flying. I remembered in the dream that I had had other dreams where I could control my flying, however in this dream my flying was limited. I impotently tried to get beyond twenty feet from the ground, but it was difficult to will it to happen. I felt the full weight of my body pulling against the gravity, but it eventually was too much for my increasingly tired mind and I returned to the safe house. 

When I returned there, Ryan was present. He was shouting, waving a knife around. Dad was unconscious on the floor, he had been bludgeoned. I could sense he wasn't dead. I was painfully conscious of how I was not overly concerned about my dream mother's safety in his situation, which made me wonder if I was either a sociopath in the dream or in real life. Or both. Or maybe I just care about Dad more. Time sort of slowed a little while I was thinking these things. When I stopped thinking them, I grabbed whatever I could that was nearby to defend myself with. It was a poker from the fireplace. The ensuing combat was incredibly terrifying, very painful and felt real to the point where I was wondering if it wasn't a dream at all. I was cut a little, got some hits in. He is stronger than me, but I am surprisingly strong for my size and very quick. It was clear to me that Ryan, after years of movies, was actually all talk and had never really considered hurting others until this. I had managed to wrangle the knife out of Ryan's hand, but shortly after when I pinned him to a desk to try and choke him unconscious he grabbed a test tube from a sort of ornamental wooden display of tubes sitting on the desk and stuck it into my throat. It felt real. It hurt. There was blood and pieces of glass cut my hand when I touched it. Having him pinned down still on the desk, I retaliated by sticking him in the neck with a pencil that was sitting on there, feeling the rubber under my thumb when I stuck it into him. I hit an artery and he was bleeding out. Dad had come to and proceeded to use his medical training from when he was a nurse to keep him bleeding to death. I presumed an EMT was inbound. Realising I hadn't been mortally wounded I got to my feet and walked into the bathroom, looking at the wound and myself in the mirror. It hurt like fuck but it wasn't too bad all things considered. I remember feeling good about having held my own, adrenaline was still making me buzz and my heart rate was back coming down from the exercise. While I was looking at myself in the mirror I very suddenly woke up.

Push 2 makes it so you can do everything on the unit, including chopping and warping the timing of samples. What a world we live in. You get to pitch and time-stretch samples without affecting one or the other.
https://www.ableton.com/en/push/
It's a hell of a piece of software and one day I'll buy the whole suite with the controller Push, all to never look back. The fucker is sublime.

You can chop a sample, pitch it and filter it and fuck with its stereo spread, then set up a click and pad it out, then consolidate what you've done to audio, warp it and fine tune the timing to the looping click, then viola - you have a loop that will always stay in time with the session and you can start chopping drums or whatever and layering sounds into discreet loops for performance and triggering. They make their own beautiful pad controller that is a marvellous feat of engineering.

Two hours a night, six days a week.

A contestant shoots me and I slowly bleed out and talk about death with a camera right up in my face. I could have medical attention but it doesn't matter. Everyone is watching. The country stops. It runs all night like when tennis just doesn't end and they can't stop the broadcast. You succumb to AIDS after a HIV positive contestant transmits it in one episode. But we do like three seasons of you straight up just giving people HIV live on TV while refusing treatment because they increase the money for each season the more volatile your illness becomes.

By this point I'm mostly cybernetic because we copied my brain over in the last episode in which I was truly alive. Eventually we're both machines, torturing people in ways that no longer make sense for the show at all. We make homages to 'I have no mouth and I must scream' by Harlan Ellison for one season and it's pretty funny for the most part.We buy the government with the revenue from international streaming.

Singing has long since been banned, but we ourselves begin to sing because we are above the law. It mocks.

Not counting for periods of stasis, Isaac is 500+ years old, worth trillions and still doing his thing. It's a good job. He's happy and it's more about seeing the work into the next evolutionary leap of humanity than it is about the money. 

Eventually the three of us are isolated from everyone else, who have met the singularity and have become one. We record another Melanomads record and it's pretty good but it doesn't matter. Nothing matters."

"Hegelâs Phenomenology of Spirit is likewise to be regarded as a type of propaedeutic to philosophy rather than an exercise in or work of philosophy. It is meant to function as an induction or education of the reader to the standpoint of purely conceptual thought from which philosophy can be done. As such, its structure has been compared to that of a Bildungsroman (educational novel), having an abstractly conceived protagonistâthe bearer of an evolving series of so-called shapes of consciousness or the inhabitant of a series of successive phenomenal worldsâwhose progress and set-backs the reader follows and learns from. Or at least this is how the work sets out: in the later sections the earlier series of shapes of consciousness becomes replaced with what seem more like configurations of human social life, and the work comes to look more like an account of interlinked forms of social existence and thought within which participants in such forms of social life conceive of themselves and the world"

The Blank Thankless Air track-by-track review of âArtpopâ by Lady Gaga.

âIf Geetroit and also Gpac, then whom is G Dilla?â â Charles Baudelaire, Untitled

AURA
Iâm yet to hear a track that deals with the westernisation of the muslim female that doesnât attempt to sell me the idea that they are oppressed. Not that they aren't, but it's as though the internal culture has been completely glossed over with the idea that one cannot find happiness in slavery. After all, isn't that what we all do? We're locked into a regime of 9-5 that exists entire independent of what our bodies and our minds need, all for this notion of the greater good and everyone having their place. 

VENUS
The line "Aphrodite Lady Seashell Bikini Garden Panty" reminds us all that long before Lady Gaga was even considering a career in anything there was the last (and shall remain last) bastion of thinly-constructed art-pop-nonsense, Masaya Nakahara. Ripped straight from a Monthly Hair Stylistics release, this title reminds those of us in the low-end of the cultural accrual that if you arbitrarily combine nouns youâre an artist.

G.U.Y.
When Zedd getâs here, the party will begin.

SEXXX DREAMS
Vowels are out, consonants are in; thereâs no way to traverse this. From PVT to MSTRKFT to SBTRKT to XX, weâre being denied the most important five letters in the English language for what is, I assume, the need to more directly imply your musical message to the masses. But canât we keep the vowels? Canât we have an uprising - a vowel movement - that attempts to reinstate the importance of vowels in an english language transaction? Iâm looking at you, OOIOO, 

JEWELS Nâ DRUGS

â¦

I canât continue to review an album that I havenât heard. I thought that my thoughts on high and low art, re: ham handed moments that occur in culture as a result of a merger of these areas, would allow an area of my brain dedicated to paying the shit out of things would take over, but alas I am an empty vessel. 
Itâs becoming increasingly impossible to communicate meaning in an age where the source material has been reconfigured to itself have no inherent meaning. I canât pay anything out when the material doesnât realise that itâs in an irony stasis impenetrable to humour. Iâm tugging at threads and, instead of a pile of wool that used to be a jumper, Iâm left with a whole mess of sheep that wonât silence. I want to sample, but I canât stand breaks. I donât even want to take a turntable and smoosh it in that way that DJâs do. I donât even have a very good turntable. I couldnât afford to buy any of the top-ten billboard charting records this month and instead had to listen exclusively to 10-20 in the charts. I studied art from a government issue book known as âTHE ART BOOKâ, which had poorly-taken black and white photos of paintings and sculptures, accompanied by casual observations written up about what they looked like and what sort of colours were present. Occasionally thereâd be a remark such as âmaybe he was painting because he was in pain, but then Rothko was also wealthy so he probably ended up okay, I donât knowâ which hinted at a deeper world in the work, but didnât have enough time in the budgeted schedule to expand upon any further.

BTA â November â 2013
âWhy on earth I took the job a Channel 7 Iâll never knowâ stated Herman Neudik, lighting a cigarette with one hand and stirring ice with a straw in a glass of what looked like coke, but was likely much harder, with the other. He somehow smoked Davidoffâs even though they were next to impossible to get in this country; his supply seldom if ever faltered for the duration of our interviews. âThe hours, the money, the workload, it all looked bang-on - but then they brought in the machineâ. 
The machine in question was the Dictaphon 9007, a product of the Grell Corporation (a lower- Iowan organisation that specialised in selling the unwanted leftover animal products from SPAM for use in feeding other, smaller animals in the small, low-end smallgoods manufacturing that had come to be a lucrative corporate venture leading up to the appointment of President J. Vernon c. 2019) in conjunction with Blume Research and Holdings (PTY LTD EST. 1973. Slogan: WE KEEP THEM AWAY!!!!!!!!!!), which was devised by a man named Artie Shewnerman. 
The pantheon of âtheyâ state that Shewnerman crafted the first prototype by hand in his workshop, shipping in parts from Grell Corporation with financing from Blume R&H PTY LTD EST. 1973, after his foil in the communion of marriage, Debra Ursula Shewnerman-Horowitz, became so entranced by silent cinema that she held her beloved Artie at gunpoint in their basement and forced him to devise a system in which the lips of every bit-part actor and extra in every silent film could be read directly from the screen and translated into subtitles and audio to increase her enjoyment of this era of cinema by untold magnitudes. Naturally, Artie is now dead. It was both the sheer strain of endless hours endured in the workshop combined with a bullet to the face from his wifeâs 44 Magnum which ultimately and quite unexpectedly provided passage for Artie into the next world. âHeâd booked in to die at the hands of a Polar Bear! It was going to be his big arctic finale!â Herman chuckled heartily at the retelling of the plight of the Dictaphon 9007âs creator. Following the development of this at-the-time niche product and the sudden and shocking death of her husband, Debra mysteriously disappeared, only to be discovered locked in a small hotel room with the Dictaphon taking up approximately 93.67% (best estimate as of 5/11/13) and thus the temperature of the room exceeded 200 Degrees Celsius, boiling Debra alive and melting the TV dinner trays that she consumed religiously into her lap. More peas and carrots than woman, an autopsy revealed that she lived a solid 48 hours into the sauna of her demise as temperatures slowly rose. 
âBut the point is that the machine was the ruin of my entire field. It cut down masters in their prime and reduced them to mere stenographersâ stated Herman as he had all but abandoned smoking a single cigarette at a time and assumed the position of chain-smoking multiplier, wielding 2-3 cigarettes in his mouth at any given moment. âWe were kings, kings I tell you! But now look at us; weâre no better than a Yak Bak.â
Herman Neudik was found dead in his home a month after our interviews concluded. Desperate times led Herman to desperate measures and he found himself pedalling a device known as âIntra-Penisâ, a tube that fed the contents of urethra during ejaculation to a plastic line that ended with a syringe. The idea for the product was to send semen directly into the human bloodstream, some sort of new fetish. During a product demonstration Herman damaged the walls of his urethra irreparably. Fearing the Morality Act which was enacted as a part of the Liberal Partyâs âAbbottCareâ Health Care plan for the people of Australia, Herman avoided seeking medical treatment and ultimately passed away in a bathtub of his own bodily fluids.

We're closer in death than ever we were in life. 

It's as though money has ceased to be of any use now that all I care about is making a connection. Not being able to pick up the bill at a restaurant causes me pain. Not shouting a round ruins a night out. Looking ever more eagerly to craft situations in which money does not come to into the picture whatsoever, I have stumbled upon subtle manipulations in which my companions in this life are put into a situation in which they cannot for the life of them ever pick up another bill again, or look after the group for a few rounds while we're out at a gig. 
	The first plan I struck upon was to plant a water-soluble laxative powder into the second or third round of drinks (my own excluded, of course) on a night out for dinner. In the rounds that followed, when things are starting to look as though we should all tuck in for the night and prepare for the day's work ahead, that's when the laxative hits them. The humbling experience of defecating one's pants in a public place is something that should be appreciated, for no experience in public thereafter would be even remotely as awkward ever again. A sobbing breakup at a cafe becomes unemotional, frankly banal. 
	About twelve months into the laxative plan, they all started heading to the bar to fetch their own drinks. Problematic, to say the least. I couldn't very well close down every venue in town and force them to dine at mine when we meet up, the practicality of this venture would be beyond reasonable, so I decided to pull an ace from up my sleeve and get them all addicted to Heroin. After all, how can one buy a round when they have no money as a result of a pricey drug addiction?
	When my plan became infinitely more difficult being that it was and still is quite hard to rouse a junkie from bed to come out to dinner, I started to look into the occult for answers. And so apparently you can murder someone by taking down detailed notes on what they're doing. At least that's the basics of it. The general idea is to attempt to link your brain waves into the exact moment their thoughts are in transit from the brain, via nerve conduction, replacing the actions they had planned to do with the ones you're currently in the middle of putting down on paper. Writing it down seems to solidify the content and imbed it into your brain wave transmissions. Thusly, create a seamless flow of thoughts being transcribed to text and you have yourself a potent method for manipulating those around you. 
	Its history is thick with anecdotes and stretches back farther than you'd be comfortable to know. I have managed to hone this skill through tireless meditation and trips to museums of modern art. Figurative drawings don't work so well in bringing these disparate sets of neuro-chemical manipulations together in one seamless act. The controller must stare for hours on end at the works lining the walls and attempt to create a simpatico between the manner in which their brain structures its ideas, much like a collage or mosaic, and the manner in which disparate elements of culture, nature, science and pure expression coalesce to make something along the lines of a Sigmar Polke. 
	The first time I attempted to use it was in a restaurant. I feel no remorse having sacrificed the life of a dear friend in this quest, for now that I've touched their basic motor functions we're closer in death than ever we were in life.

- So what was it that bought The Universal together? Any big bang of sorts?

We were assembled as a sort of A-Team by Evan. He gives us assignments and through the work we do our bond to our fellow player grows. Isaac is the Mr. T of the ensemble by a mile. That guy can do anything.

- What artists would you say have the biggest influence on the music of The Universal?

Definitely not musical ones. Evan channels the bluntness of Ricky Gervais and that informs the decisions we make. 

- The single youâve released on your Unearthed page is entitled âSexual Intellectual,â can you tell us the story behind the track and perhaps where the track name comes from?

'Sexual Intellectual' is about a person we met on tour long after we'd recorded and written the song itself, we just didn't realise it at the time. They left a really bad taste in our mouths. A person so self-absorbed that they transcended the bonds of space and time and made themselves present to our past selves. Also they were a really bad kisser. 

- Whatâs been on high rotation on your stereo lately?
Here has been an endless rotation of J Dilla and Hair Stylistics. Given how prolific they both are it's about a 1:1 ratio of Hip Hop and Noise filling the air. Pungent.
